title: Resolve deployment/build failure and publish live portfolio URL

requirements.text: Diagnose and fix the current build/deployment failure (including any Caffeine/IC deployment configuration issues and any project-level build errors) so the project builds and deploys successfully without runtime errors, TypeScript errors, routing errors, or missing asset-path errors.

quotes: so solve it and give me the result

acceptanceCriteria: A production build completes successfully with no TypeScript errors.
The deployed site loads without runtime errors in the browser console.
All routes defined in `frontend/src/App.tsx` (`/`, `/about`, `/vision-mission`, `/services`, `/gallery`, `/contact`) render successfully after deployment.
All media referenced from `frontend/src/content/galleryMedia.ts` resolves to valid URLs (no broken images for Majlis or other categories).

requirements.text: After a successful deployment, provide the live website URL and the direct Portfolio link (the live URL plus `/gallery`) as the shareable portfolio link.

quotes: so solve it and give me the result

acceptanceCriteria: A live URL to the deployed site is available.
A direct Portfolio URL ending in `/gallery` is provided.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in `backend/main.mo`; only add `backend/migration.mo` if state upgrades are required.
Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or any paths listed in `frontend.immutablePaths` (compose them instead).
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Adding new pages or features beyond fixing build/deploy and publishing the live URL.
Introducing external databases or non-supported backend technologies.
Adding third-party authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
